main_definition: A lane is a specific section of a road or path, typically used by vehicles or pedestrians to travel in an organized manner.

meanings_and_examples.example: The city has divided the main highway into three lanes for traffic flow.
Bicyclists use the dedicated cycling lane to safely ride alongside vehicles on the road.
Each aircraft is assigned a specific altitude and airspace, creating distinct lanes for safe navigation.
Ships at sea are directed into designated shipping lanes to ensure efficient and collision-free passage.
On a gaming platform, players are assigned their own unique lane within the virtual arena for strategic gameplay.
